meanings.definition: A bridge or section of road that crosses over another road or railway.
meanings.sent1: The city built new flyovers to ease traffic congestion.
meanings.sent2: I drove under the flyovers on my way to work every day.
meanings.sent3: The cars looked like tiny toys from the top of the flyovers.
meanings.sent4: The flyovers soared above the bustling city like giant metal birds.
meanings.sent5: The flyovers crisscrossed the landscape, connecting different parts of the city.

meanings.definition: The act of flying over a place or area without landing.
meanings.sent1: The pilot enjoyed the breathtaking view during the flyovers.
meanings.sent2: The flyovers provided a unique perspective of the city below.
meanings.sent3: During the flyovers, the passengers felt like they were in a movie scene.
meanings.sent4: The flyovers allowed for a quick survey of the entire region.
meanings.sent5: The flyovers gave a bird's eye view of the beautiful landscape.

meanings.definition: A type of maneuver in which an aircraft flies over a specified area.
meanings.sent1: The airshow featured impressive flyovers by skilled pilots.
meanings.sent2: The flyovers at the event thrilled the spectators below.
meanings.sent3: The flyovers were so precise, they seemed like a choreographed dance.
meanings.sent4: The flyovers added an exciting element to the aviation display.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous roar of the flyovers echoed through the valley.
